channel.title: Lifestyle on Portfolio Website for Disha
channel.description: Recent content in Lifestyle on Portfolio Website for Disha

item.title: campaign
item.description: ## Rows: 1,292,843 ## Columns: 4 ## $ cand_nm <chr> "Clinton, Hillary Rodham", "Clinton, Hillary Rodh... ## $ contb_receipt_amt <dbl> 50.00, 200.00, 5.00, 48.33, 40.00, 244.34, 35.00,... ## $ zip <dbl> 94939, 93428, 92337, 95334, 93011, 95826, 90278, ... ## $ contb_date <date> 2016-04-26, 2016-04-20, 2016-04-02, 2016-11-21, ... # Top 10 Candidates with highest Contribution total_contrb<-CA_contributors_2016 %>% group_by(cand_nm) %>% summarise(Total_contb=sum(contb_receipt_amt)) %>% arrange(desc(Total_contb)) %>% mutate(highlight_clinton = ifelse(cand_nm == 'Clinton, Hillary Rodham', T, F)) %>% ggplot(top_10_candidates,mapping=aes(x=Total_contb/10^6, y=reorder(cand_nm,Total_contb))) + geom_col(aes(fill=highlight_clinton)) + labs(title= "Candidates with highest contribution", x= "Total Contribution in million $", y="")+ theme_classic()+ scale_fill_manual(values = c('#595959', 'blue'))+ theme(legend.

item.title: Ipsum
item.description: Nullam et orci eu lorem consequat tincidunt vivamus et sagittis magna sed nunc rhoncus condimentum sem. In efficitur ligula tate urna. Maecenas massa sed magna lacinia magna pellentesque lorem ipsum dolor. Nullam et orci eu lorem consequat tincidunt. Vivamus et sagittis tempus.

item.title: tidying
item.description: Exercise in Tidying data library(tidyverse) library(tidyr) #viewing tables table1 ## # A tibble: 6 x 4 ## country year cases population ## <chr> <int> <int> <int> ## 1 Afghanistan 1999 745 19987071 ## 2 Afghanistan 2000 2666 20595360 ## 3 Brazil 1999 37737 172006362 ## 4 Brazil 2000 80488 174504898 ## 5 China 1999 212258 1272915272 ## 6 China 2000 213766 1280428583 table2 ## # A tibble: 12 x 4 ## country year type count ## <chr> <int> <chr> <int> ## 1 Afghanistan 1999 cases 745 ## 2 Afghanistan 1999 population 19987071 ## 3 Afghanistan 2000 cases 2666 ## 4 Afghanistan 2000 population 20595360 ## 5 Brazil 1999 cases 37737 ## 6 Brazil 1999 population 172006362 ## 7 Brazil 2000 cases 80488 ## 8 Brazil 2000 population 174504898 ## 9 China 1999 cases 212258 ## 10 China 1999 population 1272915272 ## 11 China 2000 cases 213766 ## 12 China 2000 population 1280428583 table3 ## # A tibble: 6 x 3 ## country year rate ## * <chr> <int> <chr> ## 1 Afghanistan 1999 745/19987071 ## 2 Afghanistan 2000 2666/20595360 ## 3 Brazil 1999 37737/172006362 ## 4 Brazil 2000 80488/174504898 ## 5 China 1999 212258/1272915272 ## 6 China 2000 213766/1280428583 table4a ## # A tibble: 3 x 3 ## country `1999` `2000` ## * <chr> <int> <int> ## 1 Afghanistan 745 2666 ## 2 Brazil 37737 80488 ## 3 China 212258 213766 table4b ## # A tibble: 3 x 3 ## country `1999` `2000` ## * <chr> <int> <int> ## 1 Afghanistan 19987071 20595360 ## 2 Brazil 172006362 174504898 ## 3 China 1272915272 1280428583 # Compute rate per 10,000 modtable1<-table1 %>% mutate(rate = cases / population * 10000) # Compute cases per year table1 %>% count(year, wt = cases) ## # A tibble: 2 x 2 ## year n ## <int> <int> ## 1 1999 250740 ## 2 2000 296920 # Visualise changes in TB cases over time from 1999 to 2000 library(ggplot2) ggplot(table1, aes(year, cases)) + geom_line(aes(group = country), colour = "grey50") + geom_point(aes(colour = country)) how are the variables and observations organised in each of the sample tables?
